00038 //Kris:  Added the last two bottom corner orientation values.  This won't effect
00039 //current code, but there is new code that makes use of this.  A function called
00040 //UINT8 CalculateWallOrientationsAtGridNo( INT32 iMapIndex ) that will look at all
00041 //of the walls and return the last two wall orientations for tiles with two proper
00042 //wall pieces.
00043 enum WallOrientationDefines
00044 {
00045       NO_ORIENTATION, INSIDE_TOP_LEFT, INSIDE_TOP_RIGHT, OUTSIDE_TOP_LEFT, 
00046       OUTSIDE_TOP_RIGHT, INSIDE_BOTTOM_CORNER, OUTSIDE_BOTTOM_CORNER
00047 };

00069 // These structures are placed in a list and used for all tile imagery
00070 typedef struct
00071 {
00072       HVOBJECT                                                    vo;
00073       UINT32                                                            fType;
00074   AuxObjectData *                               pAuxData;
00075       RelTileLoc *                                          pTileLocData;
00076       STRUCTURE_FILE_REF *                pStructureFileRef;
00077       UINT8                                                             ubTerrainID;
00078       BYTE                                                              bRaisedObjectType;
00079 
00080       // Reserved for added room and 32-byte boundaries
00081       BYTE                                                                          bReserved[ 2 ];
00082 
00083 } TILE_IMAGERY, *PTILE_IMAGERY;

00110       // This union contains different data based on tile type
00111       union 
00112       {
00113             // Land and overlay type
00114             struct
00115             {
00116                    INT16                              sOffsetHeight;    
00117                    UINT16                             usWallOrientation;
00118                    UINT8                              ubFullTile; 
00119 
00120                    // For animated tiles

00122             };
00123 
00124       };

00127       BYTE                                                                          bReserved[ 3 ];

00129 
00130 } TILE_ELEMENT, *PTILE_ELEMENT;
